data.title: Sound issue with iOS 8.1
data.body: I have tested my application on various different devices for both android and iOS and it seems that when an iOS device is running 8.1 when a sound file is played using the Music class, The sound will begin at a lower volume and then jump to a high volume a few seconds in. Here's what it sounds like https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByfvjZBeiV6qTnJhZ3Vja01KM0ZsZF9rZTQ4SmFkRlQzX24w/view?usp=sharing I have tried other audio formats and still the same problem.

data.title: Use CoreMotion instead of deprecated UIAccelerometer API
data.body: UIAccelerometer was deprecated in iOS 5. It's been removed from the RoboVM bindings. We backport it for now, but should eventually switch to CoreMotion.

data.title: HTC One Android MultiTouch bug is back - ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Remove unused imports in Shape2D
[scene2d] TextField keyRepeatInitialTime and keyRepeatTime issue
data.body:
Is there a reason why the keyRepeatInitialTime and keyRepeatTime are private inside the TextField?
I need to speed up the text selection and the cursor movements inside the text because the default values are too slow.
These fields are duplicated inside the LwjglInput class as public static properties, the difference is that inside the LwjglInput i can modify the values.

So, in summary: i can change the keys repeat time by editing the LwjglInput class but i cant speed up the selection and cursor movements inside the TextField widget.

What can i do to reach my goal?
is it possible to replace the values of TextFiled with the LwjglInput values?

data.title: TexturePacker filename bug (fix included) 1.4.1
data.body:
Hiya,

Line 92 of the TexturePacker class is currently:

packFileName = packFileName.substring(packFileName.length() - settings.atlasExtension.length());

This leaves you with files called .atlas.atlas instead of packed.atlas. Instead, it should be:

packFileName = packFileName.substring(0, packFileName.length() - settings.atlasExtension.length());

This will correctly eradicate the file extension from the provided string.

Liam

data.title: add normalized `.path()` to FileHandle
data.body:
It's a feature present both in core Java 7 lib (which is currently unsupported neither in libGDX nor on Android) [https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/nio/file/Path.html#normalize%28%29] and in Apache Commons IO [http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/apidocs/org/apache/commons/io/FilenameUtils.html#normalize%28java.lang.String%29], and is a quite nice & simple feature. It makes the path more "canonical" by getting rid of e.g. `.` & `..` and it's required in some cases, e.g. if the dotted paths point to internal JAR content (happened to me with relative texture paths provided from .MTL file); using an non-normalized path results in "file not found", using a normalized one works as expected.

Currently we have to either convert the `FileHandle.path()` by means of `URI` or include an additional library just for the sake of it, both being ugly & kludgy. Porting either Java 7's or Apache IO's normalizer (both are Open Source AFAIK) and exporting it as `.pathNormalized()` would be IMO the best solution here.

data.title: ParticleEmitter.GradientColorValue has ambiguous method signatures and no documentation
data.body:
As the title says, GradientColorValue has some pretty ambiguous method signatures.

For example GradientColorValue.setColor(float []color), takes an array of floats, but does not specify what each index of the array represents, nor does it specify how many indices are necessary. Ideally, this could be changed to:

GradientColorValue.setColor(Color color), and the code would be self-documenting.

data.title: Register 3D ParticleEffectLoader by default.
data.body: The 3D `ParticleEffectLoader` is part of the core and should be registered by default inside the `AssetManager`, just like the 2D version of it.

data.title: [libgdx wiki] "Packaging for Android" instructions don't work
data.body:
Following the wiki I encountered the [Packaging for Android chapter](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Gradle-on-the-Commandline#packaging-for-android) that has instructions that didn't work for me. 

The command `gradlew android:assembleRelease` generates an _.apk_ that fails to install on my android device. Instead, the command  `gradlew android:assembleDebug` generates a working _.apk_.
It seems that android packages created in release mode, need to be signed before installation. I found a link that explains that : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4835925/unsigned-apk-can-not-be-installed

I found that this part of libgdx wiki is a bit misleading, so if anyone could confirm this behaviour (I have no Android development experience) I'll gladly try to improve it :smile:

data.title: GWT - pixmap.drawLine and pixmap.drawPixmap do not work
data.body: pixmap.drawLine and pixmap.drawPixmap do not work on GWT but work on desktop and android. Interestingly, pixmap.fillCircle and pixmap.fillRectangle do work. This might be a small bug but the it is not obvious by looking at the code.

data.title: Cubemap isn't reloaded after openGL context loss
data.body:
When creating context libgdx calls **Texture**.invalidateAllTextures whereas Cubemap inherits from **GLTexture**

Btw, this doesn't seem to affect android 4.0.4 or 3.2.1. I've only had problems with it on 2.3 for whatever reason as if newer ones don't loss context or something.

data.title: Model and ModelInstance produce significant lag during loading
data.body:
I have a bunch of models that have 4000-6000 triangles, 15-30 bones each as well as 4 animations couple seconds long each. When one of these models is loaded with AssetManager and then instantiated with two ModelInstances on Sony Xperia U it causes very noticeable half second lag.

After profiling I found several reasons for this. First of all majority of loading time is spent in Sync method of ModelLoader with main culprit being loadAnimations of Model class (spends lots of time making NodeKeyframes from ModelNodeKeyframes). Secondly when this model is instantiated with ModelInstance all the animation keyframes as well as MeshParts are needlessly copied all over again.
For my app I was able to eliminate lag completely by making very intrusive changes for old version of libgdx a year ago and by removing needles copying mentioned above, and by removing ModelNodeKeyframe class completely and changing NodeKeyframe class slightly to accommodate for a change.

You should look whether such changes can be implemented without breaking libgdx design and whether preserving current design is worth current loading time.

data.title: [GWT] Error accessing field on deserialization
data.body:
When the GWT (app running on Google Chrome) tries to build a object from a json throws the exception:
Uncaught com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SerializationException: Error accessing field: [field name]

If the class to be parsed only have String fields works fine, even though they are private fields. The error occurs when the class have Floats and Longs.

By the way, I also tested on the last nightly build, the classes are declared at the gwt.xml to be included on the reflection process, have a default constructor, getters and setters.

data.title: Convenience methods for circle and ellipse in ModelBuilder
Fixed Oracle broken link
data.body: The link to the code converter was broken, Oracle changed a few of the digits after the 'codeconvtoc-'

data.title: Game restarts after hitting "Home' or receiving a call
data.body:
I have been struggling with this problem for a long time and haven't been able to find out a solution.

In many devices, after pausing the game (for any reason; touching an ad, receiving a call, hitting the home button, etc), the game restarts when resuming back.
It happens in all of our games, some are simple graphic games without memory consumption, some aren't. But in most devices it happens (in Nexus 5 it doesn't, don't know why).

I guess it has something to do with memory usage in libgdx, where it just can resume the current game's state and it restarts. But as i pointed out, i have this issue happening in very simple games as well.
Are there any ideas on how to approach this problem?

I googled this a lot and couldn't find anything helpful.
Thanks in advance.

data.title: Implicit version number 110 not supported by GL3 forward compatible context
data.body:
Hi. I recently updated libgdx after almost half a year and now I am seeing a crash on PC with following message at runtime:

> Implicit version number 110 not supported by GL3 forward compatible context

On Android it all runs fine.
I already tried it with:

```
config.useGL30 = false;
```

with no success. The Full Error looks like:

> Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error compiling  shader: Vertex shader failed to compile with the following errors:
> ERROR: error(#272) Implicit version number 110 not supported by GL3 forward compatible context ERROR: error(#273) 1 compilation errors.  No code generated
> 
> Fragment shader failed to compile with the following errors:
>  ERROR: error(#272) Implicit version number 110 not supported by GL3 forward compatible context
> ERROR: error(#273) 1 compilation errors.  No code generated
> 
>   at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.createDefaultShader(SpriteBatch.java:154)
>   at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.<init>(SpriteBatch.java:117)
>   at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.<init>(SpriteBatch.java:74)
>   at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage.<init>(Stage.java:99)

My google foo didnt helped me much until now. I am clueless how to solve this.

data.title: Fix potential null pointer in Android fragment's immersive mode implementation
data.body:
- When immersive mode was implemented in fragments, it worked by getting
  the parent activity's application window's decor view.
- Sometimes getActivity() can return null.
- This patch prevents the application from crashing if the view is null,
  but also uses AndroidGraphics' view for immersive mode.
- Android fragment starter now uses immersive mode by default like
  Android test starter.
- Better exception logging
  This patch resolves #2602

This has been tested on a Nexus 7 2013 running Android 5.0 build LRX21P

data.title: NullPointerException in Android while using immersive mode.
data.body:
I received this exception from a user, so I'm not sure about the specific scenario it happened.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidFragmentApplication.getApplicationWindow(AndroidFragmentApplication.java:420)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidFragmentApplication.useImmersiveMode(AndroidFragmentApplication.java:105)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidVisibilityListener$1$1.run(AndroidVisibilityListener.java:34)
at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:733)
at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:157)
at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5867)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:858)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:674)
at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

Maybe this happened because the useImmersiveMode method runs as a post message and the Activity had already finished....

Thanks.

data.title: Ignore the gradle-app.setting file.
data.body:
I believe this file can be ignored, considering that it's only useful on the machine on which it was created (unless the other users have the same exact path), and it can easily be recreated by running the '--gui' option.

It really has no reason to be there.

data.title: TmxMapLoader
data.body:
I created my .tmx map using the editor "Tiled" and i noticed that the TmxMapLoader does not support tmx files that were created using multiple images instead of a single tileset image.

If it's not clear what i'm referring to, i post a screenshot:
![cattura](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3793112/5133192/2ea8c4dc-7103-11e4-9c43-ac5e5a0b21b3.PNG)

Examining the first lines of two tmx files created in both way there is one difference:

(Created from a single image tileset)
![cattura2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3793112/5133288/4754e46a-7104-11e4-8401-903fcd3f6281.PNG)

(Created from multiple images)
![cattura1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3793112/5133293/516ef4ea-7104-11e4-878a-7e47047ba097.PNG)

Debugging my application, a NullPointerException was thrown and this was the stack trace:

Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TmxMapLoader.loadTilesets(TmxMapLoader.java:246)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TmxMapLoader.load(TmxMapLoader.java:118)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TmxMapLoader.load(TmxMapLoader.java:104)

So i went into the code and noticed that in the method "TmxMapLoader.loadTilesets" it tries to get the attribute "source" from the tileset 's child <image> but tileset does not have a child image in the case that was created from multiple images.
